channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DOJ announces plans to prioritize cases to revoke citizenship
item.description: Denaturalization is a tactic heavily used during the McCarthy era and one that was expanded during the Obama administration and grew further during Pr...

item.title: This company wants to be the first to mine the ocean floor, with Trump's help
item.description: The Metals Company is applying for permission from the Trump administration to mine for nickel and cobalt beneath a remote patch of the Pacific Ocean....

item.title: Starmer and Glastonbury Condemn Bob Vylan’s Chant Against Israel’s Military
item.description: The band Bob Vylan led a crowd in a chant of “Death, death to the I.D.F.” while performing at Glastonbury, Britain’s biggest music festival.

item.title: Click, speak, move: These brain implants are poised to help people with disabilities
item.description: People who can no longer move or speak may soon have a new option: an implanted device that links their brain to a computer.

item.title: Taiwan’s President Takes on China, and His Opponents, in Speaking Tour
item.description: Lai Ching-te is ramping up his warnings about China’s threat to Taiwan. Critics say he is stoking divisions, and risking blowback from Beijing.

item.title: What We Know About the Idaho Shooting
item.description: The authorities said a gunman started a wildfire to lure firefighters, then ambushed them in a sniper attack.

item.title: 80 years later, a Holocaust survivor meets an American soldier who helped free him
item.description: Andrew Roth survived the Nazi concentration camp Buchenwald. Jack Moran helped liberate the camp while serving in the U.S. Army. Decades after liberat...

item.title: 2 Shot Near Stonewall Inn After New York City’s Pride March
item.description: One of the victims was in critical condition after being shot in the head. Mayor Eric Adams said the shooting occurred as Pride celebrations were endi...

item.title: In effort to protect children, France bans smoking at parks and beaches
item.description: Smokers are no longer allowed to light up in public parks, at swimming pools, or at beaches, or "anywhere children may be present," said French health...

item.title: The New Cost of Trump’s Bill, and Gen Z’s Retirement Plan
item.description: Plus, the tricky science behind lime green Jell-O.

item.title: A Year After ‘Loveless Landslide,’ U.K. Leader Is Even Less Popular

item.title: Political Rivalry in Zambia Extends to Funeral of Former President Edgar Lungu
item.description: The burial site of Edgar Lungu, Zambia’s former president, has become the latest conflict in a relationship marred by hostility

item.title: Taiwan’s President Takes on China, and His Opponents, in Speaking Tour
item.description: Lai Ching-te is ramping up his warnings about China’s threat to Taiwan. Critics say he is stoking divisions, and risking blowback from Beijing.

item.title: Europe Heat Wave Drives Record-High Temperatures, Prompting Health Alerts
item.description: Extreme heat has gripped countries including France, Greece, Italy, Portugal and Spain, with record temperatures, health alerts and wildfires.
